data.title: Brenda Schrantz
data.meta_description: Brenda Schrantz passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Daily Item on 2019-05-09.
data.text:
Brenda L. Schrantz, 68, of Hellertown, died Wednesday, May 8, 2019, at her residence.

She was born June 17, 1950, in Sunbury, a daughter of the late David W. and Dorothy (Reese) Slear. She was married for 17 years and together for 27 years, to Russel L. Schrantz who survives.

Brenda began working as a seamstress at the former Grose's Silk Mill, Selinsgrove for 15 years and later worked at Boscov's for 20 years, retiring in 2018.

She was a member of New Jerusalem Evangelical Lutheran Church, Lower Saucon Township.

In addition to her husband, she is survived by two children, David W. Snyder of Mount Pleasant Mills, and Pamela S. (James C.) Pasquariello of Catasauqua; two stepchildren, Russel J., and Christopher M. (Melissa), all of Hellertown; six grandchildren, Shane, Stephanie, Jamie, Michael, Alexis, and Brianna; five great-grandchildren, Ryder, Aston, Dominic, Angelo, and Jax; one niece; two great-nieces; and two great-great-nieces. She was preceded in death by one son, James E. Snyder; and two siblings, Carl Slear and Betty Schrader.

Family and friends will be received from 1 to 2 p.m. Monday, May 13, at the Heintzelman Funeral Home Inc., 326 Main St., Hellertown, followed by the funeral at 2.

In lieu of flowers, memorials in Brenda's memory may be made to her church or to the American Cancer Society.

Online expressions of sympathy can be recorded at www.heintzelmancares.com.

Published on May 9, 2019

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
